caption:
The photograph depicts an eroded landscape predominantly characterized by muddy terrain and multiple channels of water running through it. The foreground shows a relatively flat area with a mix of rocks and debris through which narrow streams of muddy water flow, interconnecting and creating a network of small rivulets. These streams originate from the background area, which features steep, eroded cliffs partially covered by a thin layer of vegetation on the top and sides, suggesting a location impacted by heavy rain or water flow.

The soil of the cliffs appears loose and heavily eroded, indicating the possibility of recent landslides or earth movement. Small saplings and bushes cling to the uneven surfaces, implying that vegetation is attempting to re-establish itself, but the area seems vulnerable to further erosion due to lack of dense vegetation. The color palette is a mixture of earthy browns and greens, reflecting the natural environment under stress. The overall scene conveys a sense of environmental degradation, possibly from natural disasters or human activities, highlighting concerns related to soil conservation and water management.
title: Unable to absorb the driving rain, the soil is washed into a stream at Route 5 at Gravois Mills. Siltation is a problem of the lake area.
placename: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park (Mo.)
location: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park, Missouri
